clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Bromopride in indicated in the treatment of nausea and vomiting including PONV post operative nausea and vomiting gastroesophageal reflux disease GERD GORD as well as endoscopy preparation and radiographic studies of the GI tract

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Bromopride is combined with Sulpiride
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Bromopride is combined with Tetrabenazine
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Bromopride is combined with Deutetrabenazine
The therapeutic efficacy of Apomorphine can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Bromocriptine can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Levodopa can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Rotigotine can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Piribedil can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Cabergoline can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Dihydroergotamine can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Lisuride can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Fenoldopam can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Ergoloid mesylate can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Pergolide can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Aripiprazole can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Quinagolide can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Brexpiprazole can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Dihydroergocornine can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Dopexamine can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Dihydrexidine can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Dihydroergocryptine can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Metergoline can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The therapeutic efficacy of Ropinirole can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Bromopride is combined with Benzatropine
The therapeutic efficacy of Pramipexole can be decreased when used in combination with Bromopride
